description: Number of ways writing n-th prime as a sum of a nonprime and a composite.
formula: A062610(A000040(n)) = number of [nonprime+composite] partitions of p(n).
example: n=10,p(10)=29 has 14 partitions of form a+b=29; 1+28=4+25=8+21=9+20=14+15 are the 5 relevant partitions, so a(10)=5.
mathematica: Table[c = 0; Do[If[i + j == Prime[n] && ! PrimeQ[i] && ! PrimeQ[j], c = c + 1], {i, Prime[n] - 1}, {j, i}]; c, {n, 72}] (* _Jayanta Basu_, Apr 22 2013 *)
author: _Labos Elemer_, Jul 05 2001
